Report Sheets
It is felt that the report sheets are still essential
to the operation,, It is the only possible way in which the
netVvork headquarters can keep accurate records* he still
send addressed envelopes in which to return the report sheets,
but have discontinued stamping them*
The handling of the report sheets gets steadily more
complex as the number of stations increases* Since it appears
likely that some such form will be a permanent necessity, some
thought has been given to finding a simpler device* l.e have
considered mimeographed penny post-cards* Another possibility
is a printed sheet which after being filled in by the station
can be folded and seeled, the return address being printed
on the reverse side*
File Copies of Programs
As indicated earlier extended breakdowns in the network’s
service can be prevented if the master tape is retained on file
at headquarters during the cycle of the program. This has now
become standard procedure*
In addition to a temporary file copy we have begun to
maintain permanent copies of all programs offered on the network*
The administrators of the Division of Communications of the
University of Illinois decided at the outset of their custodianship
that an archival file of NAEB programs would be valuable for severa
reasons. Such material would have considerable historical interest
.—
as the beginnings of whet we have reason to hope will be a signi¬
ficant contribution to American broadcasting. At least some
of the material will have a more or less permanent use value*
It ir a real possibility, albeit remote at the moment, that a
comprehensive library service could be of inestimable value to
many organizations*
